author: user8446
body:
According to the [official docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.utility/invoke-restmethod?view=powershell-7.1), up through PowerShell v7.2 when attaching a file in the form with `Invoke-RestMethod`, the MIMEtype is hardcoded to `application/octet-stream`. From the docs:

`"If the value is a System.IO.FileInfo object, then the binary file contents will be submitted. The name of the file will be submitted as the filename. The MIME will be set as application/octet-stream. Get-Item can be used to simplify supplying the System.IO.FileInfo object."`

However, when uploading different file types to various API's, the MIMEtype needs to match the file being uploaded or it doesn't work. For example: `application/pdf`, `image/jpeg`, `text/plain`.

I consider this a bug as to not simply be able to change the MIMEtype causes `Invoke-RestMethod` to not be usable for many API's. I have searched and I could not find where this is changeable. 

## Expected behavior
For the MIMEtype to be changeable

## Actual behavior
The MIMEtype is static and not changeable from `application/octet-stream`

## PSVersion
```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19042
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

## Workaround
This is just for users that are having the same issue and come across this. In the meantime I am using cURL in PowerShell for API's that require the MIMEtype change. Just change the type after the file to what is needed:

`--form "file=@C:\Users\Path\MyFile.pdf;type=application/pdf"`

As a side note the built-in cURL on Windows 10 is still on v7.55. There have been many [bugfixes and vulnerabilities](https://curl.se/docs/releases.html) fixed since then (It's on v7.75 now). I would install the latest cURL version and then update your system PATH for the latest version.

Thank you for your consideration
title: The MIMEtype is not changeable in the Invoke-RestMethod form
